business.headline: Indraprastha Gas Limited reduces piped cooking gas prices in Delhi-NCRThe reduction follows the sector regulator Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board's (PNGRB) recent overhaul of pipeline tariffs.

Indian economy to clock strong growth despite global headwinds: RBI GovernorRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said maintaining financial stability, resilient institutions and prudent regulation remains central to safeguarding the economy from external shocks.

Investment guru Warren Buffett retires today. What's his retirement fund?As Warren Buffett, the Oracle of Omaha, steps aside after turning Berkshire Hathaway into a $1.1 trillion conglomerate, questions turn to how the world's most famous investor will fund life after hanging his boots. With nearly all his $149 billion fortune tied up in Berkshire stock, Buffett's retirement corpus is built on long-term bets, compounding, and an empire he still controls.

Earning Rs 1 crore but can't afford a Rs 5 crore home in Gurgaon? Expert explains whyA Rs 1 crore annual salary sounds more than sufficient to buy a house. Yet, many high earners find themselves priced out of the housing market. Here's what an expert says about the real reasons behind this mismatch.

Holiday vs retirement home: How to decide the purpose of your second propertyMany buyers dream of a second home, but few pause to ask a key question: Is it meant for leisure or for life after work? The answer shapes everything from location and cost to comfort and long-term suitability. Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 545 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 545.52 points to end at 85,220.60, while the NSE Nifty50 added 190.75 points to close at 26,129.60​​​​​​​.

Vodafone Idea gets more time to pay Rs 87,695 crore AGR duesAccording to sources, the AGR dues amounting to Rs 87,695 crore will now be paid over a ten-year period from FY32 to FY41. While the decision eases near-term repayment pressure, it does not involve any waiver, haircut, or reduction in the total dues.

Did New Year's Eve strike by Swiggy, Zomato riders hit customers across India?With platforms heavily dependent on delivery partners during year-end celebrations, there was uncertainty over how widely the strike would be observed.

Last day to file revised ITR: Follow these simple steps for quick processingToday is the final day for taxpayers to submit a revised Income Tax Return. If you have spotted any mistake in your earlier filing, following a few simple steps can help you complete the process quickly and smoothly.

Silver prices crash after record rally. What should investors do now?Silver futures on MCX are trading sharply lower near Rs 2,37,000–2,38,000 per kg, after closing at Rs 2,32,723 in the previous session. The decline reflects the steep correction in global prices.

Why mid-career professionals feel financially stretched after switching jobsMid-career executives usually fall into the age group of 35 – 45 depending on the industry or job roles they occupy. By this time, they have their children studying in schools, financial commitments like home and vehicle loans and, in many cases, ageing parents to look after.

Gold at record high: Why Indians are choosing coins and ETFs over jewelleryGold prices in India have surged to historic highs in 2025, leading many consumers to shift from traditional jewellery purchases to coins, bars, and other investment forms.

Swiggy, Zomato raise delivery incentive amid New Year's Eve strike: ReportThe rise in incentives comes ahead of New Year's Eve, one of the busiest days for food delivery and online orders, when worker unions have called for fresh protests.

From Reliance Jio, PhonePe to Zepto: 5 key IPOs to watch in 2026India's IPO pipeline for 2026 is packed with some of the country's most talked-about companies. From established giants like Reliance Jio to fast-growing startups such as Zepto, several big listings are expected to keep investors busy.

How India overtook China to become the world's top rice producerIndia has emerged as the world's largest rice producer, but closing the yield gap and managing water stress will decide whether this production surge becomes a lasting advantage.

Hindustan copper share price tanks 3%: What's behind the fall?Copper prices have risen sharply this year due to supply disruptions at key global mines and strong demand from sectors such as electrification, renewable energy and artificial intelligence-led infrastructure.
Sensex opens 227 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 185.43 points to 84,860.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 76.75 points to 26,015.60 as of 9:29 am.

Gold set for 50-year best, silver breaks records: Where should money go in 2026?After months of sharp gains, some investors are locking in profits, leading to short-term weakness in gold and silver. Even so, prices remain far higher than where they began the year.

Swiggy, Zomato, other gig delivery workers on New Year's Eve strike: Key demandsWorkers had already held a nationwide flash strike on December 25, which led to a 50–60% disruption in services in several cities.

Disney to pay $10m to settle children's privacy violations on YouTubeRegulators alleged that Disney failed to identify certain videos as being directed at children, despite the content being clearly child-focused. As a result, children were allegedly served targeted advertisements and had their personal information collected without proper notice to or consent from parents.

entertainment.headline: Amid Love and War delay, Vicky Kaushal praises Sanjay Leela Bhansali's vision Vicky Kaushal expressed his gratitude for getting the opportunity to work with Sanjay Leela Bhansali in 'Love and War' (2026) amid reports about the delay in the film's release. The film also features Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

Anurag Kashyap says he did not dare meet Ranbir-Anushka after Bombay Velvet flopped Anurag Kashyap opened up on how the box office failure of 'Bombay Velvet' (2015), affected his relationship with Ranbir Kapoor and Anushka Sharma. He mentioned that he did not try to meet the lead actors after the film flopped.

Ikkis gets U/A after CBFC trims India-Pakistan dialogue Sriram Raghavan's film Ikkis, based on the life of Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal, has received certification from the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) following compliance with a series of required changes and additions.

20 days, 1,000 crew: Varanasi BTS video shows how Rajamouli pulled off launch gala The makers of SS Rajamouli's upcoming film Varanasi have released a behind-the-scenes video from the film's launch event.

Alia Bhatt says motherhood changed how she chooses films Alia Bhatt discusses how motherhood has shifted her approach to work as she prepares for the release of two high-profile films, Alpha and Love & War, both slated for 2026.

How Akshaye Khanna became Rahman Dakait: Mukesh Chhabra on Dhurandhar casting Akshaye Khanna's casting as Rahman Dakait in Dhurandhar wasn't planned, it was an instinct. Casting director Mukesh Chhabra breaks down the surprising call, the four-hour narration, and the creative leap that helped shape the biggest Indian film of the year.

Alia Bhatt calls Love and War with Ranbir, Vicky very special amid delay report Alia Bhatt called Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Love and War' (2026) a "very special film," amid reports about the delay in its release. The film also features Ranbir Kapoor and Vicky Kaushal in pivotal characters.

Anupam Kher says goodbye to 2025 through a poem on love and hope On the final day of 2025, veteran actor Anupam Kher recited an emotional poem and reflected on the passing year, sharing wishes of love and hope with his fans through social media.

KBC 17: Big B revisits Sholay memories in heartfelt tribute to Dharmendra In one of the promos of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', Amitabh Bachchan honoured the legacy of his dear friend Dharmendra. He even recalled memories from their iconic film 'Sholay.'

I had 103 degree fever: Harshaali Malhotra on Akhanda 2 shoot in Godavari amid rain Actor Haarshali Malhotra has spoken about the physical and emotional challenges faced while filming Akhanda 2. She highlighted her illness and the demanding river shoot during the monsoon season.

Kim Kardashian cries over failing bar exam, sister Khloe blames her TV show. Video American television personality, Kim Kardashian's video about failing in the California Bar Exams went viral. Her mother Kris Jenner, sister Khloe and son Saint can be seen consoling her in the viral clip.

Prithviraj Sukumaran to join Nani-Sujeeth's action comedy film: Report Reports suggest Malayalam actor Prithviraj Sukumaran is part of Nani and Sujeeth's upcoming film, reportedly titled Bloody Romeo.
Hrithik Roshan's goofy New Year post with Saba Azad comes with double-thumb joke Actor Hrithik Roshan posted a series of photos with Saba Azad, accompanied by a heartfelt New Year message.

What if Stranger Things season 5 revealed its biggest twist, and we missed it? Was Stranger Things Season 5 Episode 7 badly written, or deliberately unsettling? A deep dive into the twist about what is really happening in the episode.

Hrithik Roshan not in talks for Don 3 after Ranveer Singh's exit: Source India Today has exclusively learnt that Hrithik Roshan is not in talks for 'Don 3'. The reports of his casting emerged online after Ranveer Singh's sudden exit from the highly anticipated project.

Sant: 7-part series on Neem Karoli Baba, who inspired Julia Roberts, Steve Jobs A multilingual web series, tilted 'Sant' has been announced, which depicts the life of one of India's most revered saints, Neem Karoli Baba. Steve Jobs, Mark Zuckerberg and Julia Roberts are known to be his followers among popular public figures.

Dhurandhar meets MasterChef: Chef Vikas Khanna treats Ranveer, Deepika to modaks Actor-couple Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone marked the end of 2025 in New York by visiting chef Vikas Khanna's restaurant. Their visit comes shortly after fans shared positive accounts of meeting the couple during their holiday.

AR Rahman plays angry young director in Moon Walk, film to release in May Oscar-winning composer A R Rahman will make his first appearance as an actor in the upcoming film Moon Walk, directed by Manoj NS. The film, which also stars Prabhudheva, features Rahman in a fictional role and has generated anticipation with the release of multiple character posters.

Amitabh Bachchan's early New Year wish is a math problem, can you solve it? In a new post on X, Amitabh Bachchan rang in the New Year with a quirky twist. Instead of a regular greeting, the veteran actor shared a math puzzle, leaving fans busy decoding it in the comments section.

general news.headline: Khaleda Zia laid to rest; Jaishankar meets Tarique Rahman, Pak Speaker in DhakaKhaleda Zia, the 80-year-old Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) stalwart, was laid to rest next to her husband and former President Ziaur Rahman in Dhaka. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar attended her funeral.

Pakistan will be busy in 2026 repairing airbases India struck. What's the status?Over seven months have passed since India struck 11 key Pakistani airbases during Operation Sindoor. After digging through satellite imagery and collating inputs from intelligence sources, we have found that Pakistan is still working to fix the damage. Here is a status check.

Packed with pig poop goodness: People mock Bangladesh on US corn importsPig manure is commonly used as a fertiliser in corn cultivation in the United States. The issue has gained traction and generated buzz because Bangladesh is a Muslim-majority country, where the use and consumption of pork-related products are considered haram.

Indraprastha Gas Limited reduces piped cooking gas prices in Delhi-NCRThe reduction follows the sector regulator Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board's (PNGRB) recent overhaul of pipeline tariffs.

It's 2026 already! New Zealand, Australia ring in New Year with spectacular fireworksCountries across the South Pacific were the first to welcome 2026 as New Zealand ushered in the new year with a fireworks display in Auckland, launched from the Sky Tower despite rainy weather.

India made big mistake: Pahalgam kingpin admits terror camps hit during SindoorSaifullah Kasuri, a top LeT leader, has admitted that India's Operation Sindoor hit terror infrastructure in Pakistan, even as he threatened New Delhi. Calling India's strikes a "mistake," he reiterated Lashkar's Kashmir focus, saying the outfit would "never back down from the Kashmir mission."

Setback for H-1B visa fee fight as Obama-appointed judge calls US govt move legalA US District Court has ruled that the high fee on new H-1B visas imposed by the Trump administration is legal. The petitioner, the US Chamber of Commerce, has now filed a plea with the US Appeals court. It was an Obama-appointed judge who ruled in favour of the high H-1B visa fee.

What's nati chicken, Karnataka's favourite on CM Siddaramaiah feast menu?On January 6, Bengaluru will witness a nati koli oota as CM Siddaramaiah is set to become Karnataka's longest-serving chief minister. Months back, Siddharamaiah shared a nati koli meal with his deputy DK Shivakumar, amid reports of a power tussle. So what is nati koli that the chief minister keeps returning to?

How Akshaye Khanna became Rahman Dakait: Mukesh Chhabra on Dhurandhar castingAkshaye Khanna's casting as Rahman Dakait in Dhurandhar wasn't planned, it was an instinct. Casting director Mukesh Chhabra breaks down the surprising call, the four-hour narration, and the creative leap that helped shape the biggest Indian film of the year.

Paid Osman Hadi to lobby with Yunus govt: Suspected killer releases new videoFaisal Karim Masud, who had been named as the prime suspect in the killing of anti-India radical leader Osman Hadi, released a second video within 24 hours. He said he was in Dubai and denied any link to Hadi's death. Faisal said he had given money to Hadi to lobby for his company with the Muhammad Yunus regime.

Investment guru Warren Buffett retires today. What's his retirement fund?As Warren Buffett, the Oracle of Omaha, steps aside after turning Berkshire Hathaway into a $1.1 trillion conglomerate, questions turn to how the world's most famous investor will fund life after hanging his boots. With nearly all his $149 billion fortune tied up in Berkshire stock, Buffett's retirement corpus is built on long-term bets, compounding, and an empire he still controls.

Biocon employee, 26, jumps to death from 5th floor of Bengaluru office buildingA 26-year-old employee of Biocon Biologics allegedly died by suicide after jumping from the fifth floor of his office building in Bengaluru on Tuesday, police said.

Kim Kardashian cries over failing bar exam, sister Khloe blames her TV show. VideoAmerican television personality, Kim Kardashian's video about failing in the California Bar Exams went viral. Her mother Kris Jenner, sister Khloe and son Saint can be seen consoling her in the viral clip.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

In 'love jihad' case, Muslim man poses as Hindu, gets woman to divorce husbandWhile living together, the woman overheard the accused talking to others on the phone and realised that Sonu was not Hindu but Muslim, and that his real name was Imran. A heated argument broke out on December 26, after which he allegedly began threatening her, saying he would kill her if she went to the police.

Russia releases chilling video of Ukrainian 'drone strikes' on Putin's homeThe attack on Putin's residence ahead of New Year's Eve drew concern from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who urged all parties to focus on ongoing efforts to secure peace in the region. In response, Ukraine downplayed the concerns raised by Modi and other countries, calling Russia's claims unsubstantiated.

Why having no New Year's travel plans is the best planWhether you head to Goa for its pristine beaches, Munnar for its lush greenery, Manali for its snow-capped hills, or Udaipur for its rustic charm, the story is pretty much the same at every popular destination. Maddening crowds are everywhere, ready to turn a dreamy holiday into a nightmare. At times, fatal too.

Natti chicken feast planned as Siddaramaiah closes in on record Karnataka CM tenureWith a week to go, Siddaramaiah is poised to break Devaraj Urs's record and cement his legacy as Karnataka's longest-serving chief minister.

Did New Year's Eve strike by Swiggy, Zomato riders hit customers across India?With platforms heavily dependent on delivery partners during year-end celebrations, there was uncertainty over how widely the strike would be observed.

Peanuts, Doordarshan and gajar ka halwa: A 90s New Year we didn't know was specialHandcrafted ByOur Editors New Year's Eve in 90s India was a quiet celebration centred around Doordarshan and homemade snacks. This nostalgic tradition highlights simpler times before digital distractions and lavish parties.

What if Stranger Things season 5 revealed its biggest twist, and we missed it?Was Stranger Things Season 5 Episode 7 badly written, or deliberately unsettling? A deep dive into the twist about what is really happening in the episode.

You will be punished if...: US embassy in India's latest amid H-1B visa delaysThe timing of the US embassy advisory, coming at a time when thousands of Indian professionals are stuck due to H-1B visa appointment delays, has faced backlash on social media.
Why astronauts on Space Station will celebrate New Year 16 timesAs midnight rolls across Earth, ISS astronauts who are a part of Expedition 74 toast 2026 a whopping 16 times from their speedy orbit.

Do I shoot you? Bangladesh Hindu man's colleague asked before killing himThe colleague who killed a Bangladeshi Hindu man asked him, "Do I shoot you," before ending up killing him. Bajendra Biswas, who was shot dead in a Bangladesh garment factory, might have died due to a prank by his Ansar Bahini colleague Noman Mia. Witnesses allege there was little ill will between the two, and the police are trying to determine the root cause of the death.

sports.headline: Babar vs Rizwan: When and where to watch Pakistan stars in BBL on New Year's Day BBL 2025-26: Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan will be in action on New Year's Day when Sydney Sixers and Melbourne Renegades lock horns at the Docklands Stadium in Melbourne.

WPL 2026: Lizelle Lee, Marizanne Kapp start training with Delhi Capitals in Goa Veteran South Africa all-rounder Marizanne Kapp, along with compatriot Lizelle Lee, who played a key role in Hobart's recent WBBL title triumph, has joined the Delhi Capitals training session ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League.

After Sarfaraz Khan Vijay Hazare blitz, Ashwin wants Mumbai star as CSK regular R Ashwin has backed Sarfaraz Khan to be a regular for CSK in their starting XII for the upcoming IPL season. Sarfaraz has been in scintillating form in domestic white-ball cricket for Mumbai this year.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rishabh Pant struggles for impact amid chatter of ODI snub Vijay Hazare Trophy: Delhi lost their first game in the Vijay Hazare Trophy after Rishabh Pant-led Delhi fell to Odisha on Wednesday, December 31. Pant continued to have a poor time in the competition amidst murmurs of a drop from the ODI squad.

Indian football federation asks ISL clubs to confirm participation amid delay The AIFF on Wednesday asked ISL clubs to confirm their participation and preferred format for the delayed season within a day to inform the continental body of the match count.

Shreyanka Patil touched as RCB fan names daughter in her honour before WPL 2026 RCB all‑rounder Shreyanka Patil touched hearts off the field when a fan named their daughter after her. She is set to make a strong comeback in WPL 2026 after missing out last season due to injury.

Mohammed Shami confident of ODI comeback against New Zealand Fast bowler Mohammed Shami's camp is confident that the fast bowler will make his return in international cricket with the ODI series against New Zealand. Shami has been in terrific form since the start of the home season.

Australia's Travis Head hopes to revive Ashes tradition with post-series drinks Travis Head hopes Australia and England will come together for a drink once the Ashes concludes in Sydney, restoring a tradition that was lost after the 2023 series.

Vaishnavi Sharma spills the secret behind special celebration with Harmanpreet Kaur Vaishnavi Sharma revealed that her choreographed wicket celebration with Harmanpreet Kaur in the fourth Women's T20I was a pre-planned team-huddle idea, capping an impressive series in which she emerged as a joint-highest wicket-taker.

Inspired by icons: Jerrssis Wadia draws lessons from Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh Australian youngster Jerrssis Wadia, inspired by Yuvraj Singh's comeback and shaped by lessons from Virat Kohli and Travis Head, has announced himself in BBL 2025–26 for the Adelaide Strikers.

Bumrah's No.1 Test rank under threat from Australia pacer, Pakistan spinner Jasprit Bumrah's spot at the top of the ICC Test rankings for bowlers continues to remain under threat with Mitchell Starc and Noman Ali breathing down the neck of the Indian pacer.

Gulbadin, Naveen return as Afghanistan name Rashid Khan-led T20 World Cup squadRashid Khan will lead Afghanistan in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, to be staged in India and Sri Lanka. The Afghanistan Cricket Board confirmed the leg-spinner as captain while announcing a 15-member squad for the marquee tournament.

Not a Test specialist any more. Sarfaraz Khan smashes 75-ball 157 after IPL contractVijay Hazare Trophy: Sarfaraz Khan smashed a 75-ball 157 for Mumbai, steering them to a mammoth total of 444 in Jaipur on Wednesday. Sarfaraz has been in fine form in white-ball domestic circuit.

Cristiano Ronaldo hits 'cringe' SIU, fans calls out shameless celebrationLegendary Cristiano Ronaldo was heavily criticised by football fans after wildly celebrating one of his goals in the Saudi Pro League. Many called him selfish, stating that Ronaldo is only motivated to score 1000 career goals and does not care about his team and teammates.

Gaikwad warms up for New Zealand series with splendid century in Vijay HazareRuturaj Gaikwad scored a magnificent 124 to help Maharashtra post 331 against Uttarakhand in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He will next feature in India's ODI series against New Zealand starting January 11.

Padikkal knocks on India ODI selection door with 3rd hundred in four matchesKarnataka batter Devdutt Padikkal kept his India ODI ambitions firmly alive with his third century in four matches in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy. The left-hander continued his prolific run by reaching three figures once again, this time against Puducherry at the ADSA Railways Cricket Ground in Ahmedabad.

England to win next Ashes in Australia: Former cricketer makes bizarre predictionFormer England cricketer Phil Tufnell has made a bold prediction regarding England's Ashes prospects in Australia. The former spinner has backed the English side to end their Ashes series victory down under in their next series in the country.

Cricket fraternity rallies around Damien Martyn as serious illness leaves him in comaAdam Gilchrist, R Ashwin and VVS Laxman were among the cricketers who sent messages of support to Damien Martyn after the former Australia batter was hospitalised with meningitis. Messages from across the cricketing world followed as former teammates, opponents, and current players wished Martyn strength and a speedy recovery while he remains under medical care.

These are our favourite sporting moments of 2025. What is yours?Records fell, waits ended and futures arrived early in 2025, a year when sport refused to slow down, and left us all with moments worth arguing about long after the final whistle. Which moment gave you goosebumps, joy or disbelief? Tell us the one you'll never forget.

After World Cup snub, Gill to play Vijay Hazare Trophy in January: ReportShubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul will play in the Vijay Hazare Trophy in January. The trio will leave their respective teams ahead of the three-match ODI series against New Zealand, beginning on January 11.

Arsenal end 2025 on top, Man United stumble against bottom-placed WolvesPremier League 2025-26: Arsenal delivered a commanding 4-1 win against Aston Villa to end 2025 at the top of the table. Meanwhile, Manchester United struggled to a 1-1 draw with bottom-placed Wolves on Tuesday night.

Ashes hero Travis Head makes crucial BBL call ahead of T20 World CupTravis Head, who has played a key role in Australia's Ashes dominance, is likely to sit out of the Big Bash League season. The left-handed opener said he is focussing on remaining fresh for T20 World Cup, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

Damien Martyn in induced coma, battling for life against MeningitisFormer Australian cricketer Damien Martyn is in an induced coma fighting meningitis. His condition has drawn widespread concern and prayers from the cricket community across Australia.

Indian sports in 2025: Handshake rows, stampedes and controversies that shaped the yearFrom league uncertainty and safety scares to stampedes, political snubs and war halting the IPL, Indian sport in 2025 was defined by chaos, controversy and failures that overshadowed competition.

Carlsen now a 20-time world champion, ends 2025 with Rapid and Blitz doubleMagnus Carlsen extended his dominance by winning a record ninth World Blitz title along with the Rapid gold medal in Doha. Carlsen defeated Uzbek GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov after producing a stunning, unexpected pawn move in the fourth game of the clash to seal a 2.5–1.5 victory.

Margins to mainstream: India women's cricket team wins Battle of the Sexes in 20252025 was the year Indian women's cricket earned the respect it deserved, with India lifting their maiden ICC title — the ODI World Cup. The challenge for India in the coming year will be to maintain that consistency and, perhaps, add a T20 World Cup title at Lord's to their growing legacy.

Jemimah selfie, debutants lifting trophy: India sign off in style after Sri Lanka sweepJemimah Rodrigues took her signature selfie and the debutants Kamalini and Vaishanavi Sharma lifted the trophy for the side as India celebrated their 5-0 series win over Sri Lanka in style on Tuesday, December 30.

Carlsen reaches World blitz C'ships final after turnaround, Erigaisi gets bronzeArjun Erigaisi's remarkable World Blitz campaign ended with a semifinal loss to Nodirbek Abdusattorov, earning the Indian Grandmaster a historic double bronze. Magnus Carlsen set up a final showdown with Abdusattorov after overcoming Fabiano Caruana.

5th WT20I: India thump Sri Lanka to complete 5-0 clean sweep, ends 2025 with a bangWith the final game of the series, Sri Lanka finally decided to wake up and put up their best performance in the series. But India proved to be too good for them as they went on to take the win by XX runs to complete the 5-0 series whitewash in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday, December 30.

BBL: Taxi breaks down, Perth Scorchers players arrive at stadium by pushing UberBBL: Hilarious scenes unfolded on Tuesday after some of the Perth Scorchers players got stuck on their way to the stadium. While travelling to the stadium, their Uber broke down, but they managed to revive the situation.

Watch: Glenn Phillips turns left hander, stuns fans with mega sixesNew Zealand batter Glenn Phillips stunned the crowd by turning into a left-hander. Playing in the Super Smash, Phillips slam-banged his way to an unbeaten 90 runs off just 48 balls.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
